text: Marianne Louise Thieme (born March 6, 1972 in Ede) is a Dutch animal rights activist and writer, and also a former politician of the Party for the Animals (PvdD). She is co-founder of the party, and was political leader from 2002 till 2019. She was a member of the Second Chamber and also parliamentary leader from 2006 till 2019. Previously she was party chair from 2002 to 2010. Esther Ouwehand has succeeded her as party and parliamentary leader. Thieme studied law at Erasmus University Rotterdam. She is a member of the Seventh- day Adventist Church and a vegan. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Animal rights activists Category:Bloggers Category:Dutch activists Category:Dutch jurists Category:Dutch party chairs Category:Dutch Protestants Category:Leaders of political parties in the Netherlands Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Politicians from Gelderland Category:Seventh-day Adventists Category:Vegetarians Category:Writers from Gelderland
title: Marianne Thieme
